info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 27 at 10:40PM CDT until April 27 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS North Platte NE
info.description:
At 1038 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 7 miles west of Merritt Reservoir, or 29 miles southwest of Valentine, moving northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation.
IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely.
This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Cherry County, including the following locations... Highway 97 crossing the North Loup River, Schoolhouse Lake, Steer Creek Campground, and Anderson Bridge State Wildlife Management Area.
This includes Highway 97 between mile markers 93 and 124.
info.instruction:
Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
If on or near Merritt Reservoir, get away from the water and move to safe shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Severe thunderstorms can produce large capsizing waves, even on small bodies of water. Move into dock and seek safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

parameter.value: A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CHERRY COUNTY
